name: rumex altissimus
description: Pale Dock is typically found in wet soils along streams and other moist-soil situations.  It can also tolerate medium-moist soils and somewhat shaded areas.  It is most conspicuous later in summer when the seeds turn a russet red-brown color, which contrasts with the dominant green vegetation.
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
